document.masterDocTitle: Species of the genus Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea, Decapoda, Galatheidae) from the Indian and Pacific Oceans, with descriptions of 92 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Species of the genus Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea, Decapoda, Galatheidae) from the Indian and Pacific Oceans, with descriptions of 92 new species

bibRefCitation.author: Miyake
bibRefCitation.refString: Miyake, S. & Baba, K. (1964) Two new species of Galathea from Japan and the East China Sea. Journal of the Faculty of Agriculture, Kyushu University, 13, 205 - 211.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Not
Galathea balssi .
—Poore et al. , 2008 : 19 (SW Australia , 100–382 m ) (=
Galathea argus
n. sp.
).
Material examined . Japan . Kochi Prefecture, no depth recorded: 1 ov. F 5.3 mm ( SMF ).

Indonesia . Kei Islands. KARUBAR, Stn CP66, 09°01'S ,
132 °09'E
, 211–217 m ,
1 November 1991
: 1 F 6.6 mm (MNHN-IU- 2013-8245 ).
Remarks. The material examined agrees quite well with the original description and illustrations. Nevertheless, the parahepatic and epigastric spines can be absent in some specimens.

Galathea balssi
resembles
G. galene
n. sp.
from Vanuatu (see below under Remarks for the latter species).

Distribution . Western Pacific, from Japan to Queensland and Vanuatu ,
31– 222 m
.
